db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The list type refers to a list of QML objects.
A list value can be accessed in a similar way to a JavaScript array:

db:listitem.db:para: Values are assigned using the [] square bracket syntax with comma-separated values
The length property provides the number of items in the list
Values in the list are accessed using the [index] syntax

db:section.db:para: Values can be dynamically added to the list by using the push method, as if it were a JavaScript Array
A list can only store QML objects, and cannot contain any basic type values. (To store basic types within a list, use the var type instead.)
When integrating with C++, note that any QQmlListProperty value passed into QML from C++ is automatically converted into a list value, and vice-versa.

db:note.db:para: The list type is not recommended as a type for custom properties. The var type should be used instead for this purpose as lists stored by the var type can be manipulated with greater flexibility from within QML.
